lang.word_default: Outputs your page within the IPB header/footer wrapper. If you select 'No', you will be responsible for the full page html (including doctype, head, body, etc. tags)
Default block templates have been updated

IP.CCS provides a way for you to access the system from outside of IPB. This is useful, for instance, if you want CCS to run your website from the root of your domain, but keep your forums in a /forums subfolder. In order to utilize this capability, you will need to configure the settings below. Additionally, you will need to upload the 'index.php' file found in the Tools folder of your download to the directory IP.CCS will be accessed from, and configure the path inside of it. If you would like to rename index.php to something else, you must specify the filename for 'Gateway filename'.

More information on how to access pages in IP.CCS and how to use the included index.php file is available in the README.txt file found within the Tools folder.
The PHP page content is run through eval, and as such you can not manually include '<?php' tags.
You must rename media_path.dist.php to media_path.php in your forum root directory to use this feature.

Helpful if you need to pause the session and return later
What type of block is this?
create a data feed to put on any page. Available options depend on the applications you have installed.
Examples: Last 10 news posts, Last 5 images uploaded to your IP.Gallery, Top 10 posters on your forum
execute a custom block plugin. You can create your own plugins, or download them from the resource site.
Examples: Online users, Forum statistics, Polls
create custom blocks to cover any other need.
Examples: Advertisements, Javascript widgets (e.g. stock tickers, gamer feeds, etc.), Notices/Announcements
These are the files being moved
Are you sure you wish to proceed? There is no undoing this action!
Give the template a unique key
A short description to describe the template

Indicates where the actual page content will go. By using this special tag, you can edit the content on pages independent of this template, and changes to this template will be inherited to all pages using this template.
Use this special tag to control where the meta keyword and description tags are output
Use this special tag to output the title of the page (e.g. in between <title> or <h1> tags)
Use an editor (with bbcode support) to specify the block content.
Specify PHP code to execute (you should echo any content you want to display).

Editing entire page - not inheriting from template

Note: You are editing only the page content, and not the entire page. You can edit the rest of the page, including the layout and blocks, under the page template manager. This is the recommended method of editing pages. Template Tag Help.

Note: You are editing the entire page. If you based this page on a template, and you later edit that template, those changes will not be automatically reflected in this page. If you wish to inherit future changes to the page template you are basing this page on, you should click "Use Wizard" at the top, and when prompted select "Yes" for "Only edit page content?". Template Tag Help.

Note: You are editing the entire page. If you based this page on a template, and you later edit that template, those changes will not be automatically reflected in this page. If you wish to inherit future changes to the page template you are basing this page on, you should start over and select "Yes" for "Only edit page content?". Template Tag Help.
Used to identify page, and as the page title
Used in the URL to access the page. Extension added automatically.

Note: You are caching the entire page, include block contents. You should be careful caching pages meant to be dynamic.

Unfinished blocks are blocks you have started but not yet finished, or blocks you have begun editing but have not saved the changes to yet. If you are editing a block and delete the unfinished copy, you only delete the changes and not the original block.

Unfinished pages are pages you have started but not yet finished, or pages you have begun editing using the wizard but have not saved the changes to yet. If you are editing a page and delete the unfinished copy, you only delete the changes and not the original page.
